head.supplied: 22 ulto furnishing suggestions with respect to the management fencing and planting of the Yarra Park. ¶ ¶ I am to express the thanks of the Health Committee of the Council of the City of Melbourne fo...

div.p: Unit 14, p. 156, VPRS 4025/P Town Clerk's letter press copy books, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: M had recommended that no fencing be erected along the Yarra River but that, instead, cattle be excluded from the area of Yarra Park; see M to J. Smith, 22 April 1868. His letter was considered at a meeting of the Melbourne City Council Health Committee on 30 April 1868; the present letter is dated to early May since it reports the decision made at that meeting. 22 ulto furnishing suggestions with respect to the management fencing and planting of the Yarra Park.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p:
I am to express the thanks of the Health Committee of the Council of the City of Melbourne for the attention which you have given to the matter and for your kind offers of assistance. I am to state however that the Committee think that the erection of fences along the Yarra Bank road will be advantageous for the protection of trees and the prevention of accidents to
Something missing? See 'The month', Illustrated Australian news for home readers, 23 May 1868, p. 2, col. c, for an account of an accidental drowning near the Botanic Gardens: 'Since the accident, Dr. Mueller, though not the responsible party, has considerately caused a double fence to be placed across this path, so as to prevent any similar occurrence taking place again'.
